39481494.review:
Troisième volet de la saga « Enigmatis », [i]The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] nous lance aux trousses d’un prêcheur-tueur-en-série qu’il faut arrêter avant qu’il ne réveille un démon.

Le scénario est solide, l’histoire prenante et l’ambiance garantit une expérience de jeu agréable. L’avantage des jeux Artifex Mundi, c’est qu’ils sont tous construits de la même manière, donc il est très facile de s’approprier les contrôles si vous avez joué à l’un des jeux du développeur précédemment. 

Le fait que les jeux soient construits sur le même modèle laisse craindre un côté répétitif de l’intrigue, ce qui est loin d’être le cas ici. Certes, l’histoire est linéaire, guidée, et on regrettera que le monde ne soit pas plus ouvert, néanmoins le jeu reste très agréable. On appréciera notamment la possibilité offerte aux joueurs de basculer vers un memory dans les puzzles « objets cachés » (tout le monde n’aime pas les challenges objets cachés. J’en sais quelque chose puisque je ne les aime pas particulièrement !). 

On appréciera aussi le chapitre qui se débloque une fois le jeu achevé et qui vient ajouter une véritable profondeur à l’histoire, confirmant par là un parti pris du développeur de miser sur le scénario plus que sur l’originalité des graphismes ou du moteur.

39419081.review:
Review originally posted [url=https://www.backlog-assassins.net/posts/el5aqrb/]here[/url].

9/10

This is the best hidden object game I’ve ever played.

Now, it’s not like I’ve played a ton of them. At this point I’d say I’d played at least a dozen, maybe closer to twenty, and I have another half-dozen to play. But this one… oh. This one is so good.

Going from playing an older Artifex Mundi game to this really brings into focused how much it had matured as a company. Everything is better. The art, the 3D models and simulations, the story, the experience direction w/r/t level design and tone and pacing. The voice acting! That One Lady returns as the lead but holy shit when she emotes, she EMOTES.This character also delivers the most badass line uttered in any hidden object game, and it’s right up there among badass game lines in any genre: ‘I’m coming for you, Preacher. You’d better say a prayer… for yourself.’ Jesus christ, right?

Like, this game opens on your plane crashing and you struggle to not get sucked out of the cockpit. Artifex Mundi grabbed the boundaries with what is standard with 2D experiences and shoved them down some stairsteps. There was such a fluidity in this game, such a level of detail. There are a dozen or more hidden object scenes and you only play through each one once!!! That’s crazy!

This is a pretty straightforward old school adventure game in two parts (the second, Blood in the Snow, unlocks once you clear the main adventure).  The difficulty is, let's say mild -- I never used a hint and never got stuck.  But at no point while playing did it feel like I was wasting time or falling back to the classic "try every object on everything that seems interactive" trial and error solution.

Fair warning, though, it's very short, even with BB's adventure added in.  Another thing, the game lags often when moving from one area to the next or loading cutscenes (on my fairly powerful PC).  Don't assume that it has crashed as it is simply loading the next area in a very unoptimized way.

36561299.review:
Niby trzyma poziom trylogii, ale to już ta HOPA Artifexa w której są przedobrzone sceny z ukrytymi przedmiotami. Standardzik: przedmiot w niemal tym samym kolorze co tło, albo wystający tylko jakimś rąbkiem przywalony innymi rzeczami, albo ustawiony w taki sposób żeby miał nienaturalny dla siebie kształt, albo umieszczony w scenie razem z innymi identycznymi przedmiotami (scena gdzie trzeba znaleźć obiektyw, i jest z 10 obiektywów)... Te sceny (podobnie jak w Grim Legends 3) są męczące i zaprzeczają idei tego typu gier, które w założeniu mają być relaksujące, a przechodzenie gier HOPA dając "pomiń", "pomiń", "pomiń" nie daje satysfakcji (ponadto uniemożliwia zdobycia jakichś achievementów). Dodatkowe motywy (skazy, pióra i kwiatki) poukrywane w zwykłych scenach są zupełnie przegięte (co najmniej połowę z nich trafiłem bardziej klikając na nie przypadkiem, niż je wcześniej dostrzegając, wyjątkiem były kwiatki, których było tylko kilka i rzeczywiście były względnie łatwe do wychwycenia).

Co do łamigłówek to już nie pamiętam (już jakiś czas temu w to grałem, gdy to piszę), ale też mogło być w nich coś co mi nie przypasiło. 
Na pewno zdarzało mi się okazać irytację, gdy należało łączyć jakieś przedmioty z interaktywnymi elementami w danej scenie - nie zawsze było to logiczne, a to już jest cecha której nie znoszę w klasycznych przygodówkach, takie trochę rozkminianie: "co autor miał na myśli?", "jakie idiotyczne powiązanie tutaj będzie?". Na szczęście nie było tego dużo, ale pokazuje to, że chyba ludzie w Artifexie są nieco znudzeni gatunkiem i chcą na siłę swoje gry utrudniać, co wcale nie musi być takie pożądane, lecz to zależy od odbiorców - ja wolę casualowe, relaksujące pogrywanie w ten gatunek i dlatego trochę mnie to męczyło.

Czym się gra broni? 
Oczywiście oprawa audio-wizualna w najnowszych grach tego studia stoi na bardzo porządnym poziomie. Fabuła jest niezła, choć może i przewidywalna (zbyt dużo informacji dostajemy żeby nie domyśleć się twistu w końcówce), ale narracja jak to w tej serii jest bardzo solidna i potrafi zbudować klimat (druga część była jednak lepsza).

Generalnie cała trylogia do zaliczenia, bo fabularnie to jedna z lepiej zrobionych serii typu HOPA, i tych parę przywar w części trzeciej, o których tu wspomniałem, nie zepsuło mi odbioru całości.

In a desperate attempt to avoid repeating myself I'm just gonna say that the final chapter of the Enigmatis trilogy is not only a satisfying closure in terms of narrative, but also carries all the qualities that made me to appreciate the works of Artifex Mundi in the first place.
The beautiful environments and captivating atmosphere coupled with challenges having just the right difficulty level, the gorgeus and accessible interface with all the helpful and optional stuff to make your potentially frustating experience as smooth as humanly possible are all the right features to keep me playing their titles no matter the setting or the amount of them.

As long as the level of general quality stays this way, I surely will come back time and again for some good old point n' clickin'. Now, off to the next one! :D

34856264.review:
Энигматис 3: Тень Кархалы – это заключительная часть трилогии по поиску предметов Enigmatis. Демонический пастор сбежал в горы и снова пытается обрести полную власть. Девушка-детектив со своим напарником опять отправляются на поиски злого колдуна. Собрав новые улики в Мэйпл-Крик они направляются в опасное путешествие в горный монастырь, чтобы поймать пастора. Вас ждёт несколько неожиданных поворотов сюжета. 
Игра сделана на отличном уровне – сцены поиска хорошо прорисованы, так что искать предметы одно удовольствие. На некоторых локациях для поиска одного предмета сначала нужно сделать необходимые два-три дополнительных действия. Головоломки в игре не очень сложные, даже на уровне эксперт. Музыкальное сопровождение на отличном уровне, очень хорошо подобрано к сюжету.  В игре осталась доска улик – на которой, соединяя улики, можно сделать выводы и узнать куда нужно идти. Сцены поиска предметов можно заменить на альтернативный поиск одинаковых карточек. В игре нужно собрать все белые перья, вдовьи слёзы и лики зла. С последними пришлось попотеть, так как их нужно искать сразу, как только вы  попали на локацию, иначе они исчезают. После прохождения игры становятся доступны бонусы – обои, музыка, возможность заново пройти головоломки и т.д.  Так же открывается бонусный уровень, пройдя который вы узнаете чем закончилась история.  
Перевод на русский язык на отличном уровне. У меня трудностей с пониманием не возникло.
В игре присутствуют коллекционные карточки и 34 достижения, заработать которые реально. 
Рекомендую всем любителям жанра!
Оценка 10/10

34468765.review:
This game has hung-up multiple times after pressing the MENU button, then finally, I can't get past the base camp scene without freezing the computer up totally.  My system is HP p6130f, running Linux Mint 18.2 and steamOS.  The first two games (Enigmatis 1&2) ran flawlessly on this same system.

UPDATE:  I finally was able to finish the game, although it required scores of hard computer resets and reboots.  Saving the game was very challenging at most locations throughout the game, especially at the Cabin and the Base Camp scenes.  Almost totally unplayable.  It was difficult to enjoy the game when the real puzzle was just trying to keep it from dying.

The root problem here is probably my video memory, which is specified at 256 MBytes (shared), the same as the game requirements.  Given that I'm running Linux, not Windows, it probably isn't quite enough and I should reduce my display resolution, but that ruins the experience.   I've been wanting to upgrade my computer anyway, so this is probably the motivation that causes me to do it.

FINAL UPDATE:  I reduced my screen resolution and that did the trick.  The game is playing flawlessly now.  I've also ordered another CPU/Motherboard/memory/video to upgrade my 8 year-old computer to a more modern configuration (8 cores and 16 GByte memory).  I want to be able to use the full resolution of my very fine monitor.

I'm changing my recommendation for this game from NO to YES.  Just don't play it on older hardware.

33737205.review:
The Enigmatis series is definitely more than basic HOG material, and Shadow of Karkhala actually plays more like an adventure game, with a real story, than a basic HOG.  If it weren't for one problem, I'd recommend it without reservation.  As it is, I have to caution you about the problem and let you judge how much an issue it will be for you.

I'm afraid fellow reviewer Mugros is right.  8 to 12 second black screen load times, often for just 1 or 2 seconds of video.  It's hard to think of a better destroyer of mood, whether it's tension, excitement or fear, when you have to just twiddle your thumbs waiting for the game to continue.  The climatic boss battle is interrupted by about six of these loading delays, including a back-to-back pair where you get one line of dialog with no visuals before the 2nd delay kicks in.  This just drains the thrill right out of it.  He's also right about the frame rate issues in the bonus story.  I also noticed that this particular game is very slow to shut down, taking about 15 seconds.  This delay is consistent when playing online or offline.

My system has 24 cores, 64GB, and comparably fast and large hard drives.  Murgros was using a solid-state drive.  It's hard to see how our systems could be considered under-powered for a 2D adventure game with occasional video overlays!

33727139.review:

Up to about 10 seconds which is quite annoying. Sometimes this even interferes with the playback of cutscenes and they are partly not visible. In the bonus mission this also happens, but the game has also severe framerate issues that weren't in the main game. I have a fast gaming computer with a fast SSD, so it is not lack of power or load times.

30923916.review:
[h1]Short version: 56%[/h1]
While Enigmatis 3 gives a nice, cinematic conclusion to the trilogy, its on-the-rails plot, insane moon logic, and tedious hidden object scenes make a huge step backwards compared to the masterpiece that was Mists of Ravenwood.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Trilogies like to shake things up by the third part, and Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala is a great example for that. This series, previously known for its great supernatural crime mysteries, suddenly decided to go Tomb Raider with a trip to the Himalayas, completed with every tired archaeological adventure cliché under the sun. Moreover, it is not even a good adventure with its tired plot dumps and railroaded, restrictive, sometimes downright lazy level design and progression.

Speaking of progression, the gameplay is one of the greatest enemies. The hidden object puzzles feel tedious and needlessly drawn-out, but it is mild in comparison to the illogical point ‘n’ click mechanics, which may force brute-force trial-and-error at some parts with their unpredictable solutions.

I won’t dissuade anyone from Enigmatis 3, because, in the end, it is a nice, cinematic conclusion to the saga—but it is the only reason to be invested in this game.

30565831.review:
The second game in that trilogy is very celebrated and I played it with hope. I ended up really liking it despite some flaws, so I was eager to complete the story with this third episode. Well, every little flaw from the second one seems to be magnified in the third. In fact, while I usually avoid pro/con lists because I find them to be an easy way out for reviewers, I think it's worth it this time, if only to accurately record how you can go from a memorable game into a mediocre follow-up without seemingly changing anything to the formula.

Pros:
- The graphics are a bit better-- some 3D effects, notably. The music isn't memorable but isn't too bad either.
- Some of the actions are more dynamic. They wanted to give it a more action-oriented feeling, thankfully without the actual action (they know their target audience.)

Cons:
- Yes, that was it... Two pros. Get prepared for a long list of cons, and I didn't even take notes so there's probably more to say.
- The game is probably a tad longer than the second one, but it's a con here because there are less things to see, less things to do, and it's always blizzard-blizzard-blizzard and the occasional "oh, no blizzard... Just give it 5 minutes and the next scene will have blizzard in it." That's a Far Cry 4™ from the second episode's beautiful scenes.
- In fact, you're given a map early in the game, which implies you'll be moving a lot... Yeah, between two screens. Every time you move onto a new area, you get locked out of the previous one. You simply never get to use the map, as it has no point.

- Mini-games are easy as hell. I don't even know why they bothered with the Skip button... I recently played the Robinson Crusoe series of hidden object games and they were much more challenging and enjoyable. And they're always the same kind of puzzle game. Also, if in real life I was an anthropologist/archeologist/generic scientist looking into the legacy of another people, I would definitely steal everything and send it to a museum, seeing that every little device I find is broken and needs to be fixed. Do they have no respect for their own culture?! Or is a political statement? That the White Man is easily fooled by a "sort these items by their color" puzzles? I'm not even sure my 3yo would consider them an obstacle... Or he'd just wreck everything for fun.
- Hidden object scenes are much more annoying (and as often happens, they're repeated multiple times). The only chances where you'll get achievements are at the beginning and in special scenes where you have to find graphical representations of objects (because you're less likely to make a mistake). It doesn't happen a lot. It took me a lot more effort than it was worth. Damn auto-saving!

- I liked the second episode's random 'evil' pictures that showed up in the scenery. In this one, they're integrated and never flicker, so you're just condemned to closely look at every single picture and hope you don't miss anything. I ended up using a community guide to find them all, and of course I'd missed a couple in the beginning.
- While Enigmatis 2 was already a bit like that, the third one really follows the stupidest possible path: find items, use them somewhere, this unlocks another item which you can use somewhere else to unlock something else. The linearity in this game is sickening. There is very little thinking, just tinkering.

- Voice acting is as mediocre as before. But this time one of the characters (Fang's father) sounds like he recorded all of his lines over the phone. Then again, with the lines he was given, I'm not surprised he couldn't bother.

- The story is just a rehash of the second episode, with Tibetan folklore put into the mix. I'm not sure if that's uninspired or just plain insulting to them.
- Enigmatis 2 had a rushed but satisfying ending. Enigmatis 3 has a rushed ending. Satisfying? You don't even get to see the main characters' faces in the last picture. Ah ah. It's just a mess.
- So? Doesn't matter, there's a bonus chapter! We'll get our proper epilogue! Uh... No wait, it's a prequel chapter? Again?? With that character whom we already know was killed by the villain? So... We're going to be living through her last few hours right? Oh, they know how to sell their exciting plots. And here we go, valiantly going into a dead-end story that has no relevance for the main story and frustrates even more those who went through Enigmatis 2 and hoped for a good ending. Nope, you don't get that.

So, guys, you don't get my thumb up this time.

Willkommen zu ENIGMATIS 3: THE SHADOW OF KARKHALA. 
Nach den hervorragenden ersten Teil und den genauso guten zweiten Teil ist die Erwartung für den dritten Teil natürlich entsprechend hoch. Die Geschichte hat mit Teil 1 Fahrt aufgenommen, ging mit Teil 2 rasant weiter und steuert nun auf das Finale zu.

Wie der Einleitungstext bereits verrät ist unsere Hauptdastellerin auf der Jagd nach den Prediger, der schon unzähligen das Leben gekostet hat. Begleitet wird sie dabei von Hamilton der in den vorherigen Teilen auch schon eine Rolle gespielt hat. Das Spiel startet rasant, das möchte ich hier nicht spoilern, und führt unsere Helden ins Karkhala Gebirge. Dort geschehen seltsame Ereignisse und auch ein mythisches Fabelwesen scheint dort sein Unwesen zu treiben.

Das Spiel hat wie bei seinen Vorgängern sehr schön gezeichnete Bilder. Die Suchbilder gestalten sich weiterhin als angenehm und auch die Minispiele stehen den beiden Vorgängern in nichts nach. Sehr schön auch das man einen Ort aus den ersten Teil besucht. DIe Musikuntermalung ist wie die Geräuschkulisse wieder gut gewählt.

 ENIGMATIS 3 enttäuscht nicht, aber ist für mich dennoch der schwächste der 3 Teile, weil sich die Handlung stellenweise etwas wie Kaugummi zieht und vielleicht weil meine Erwartung vielleicht ein wenig zu hoch war. Vielelicht auch weil die beiden Vorgänger irgendwie etwas gruseliger waren.
Das ändert aber nichts daran das es Spaß macht und die Trilogy schön abschließt. Eigentlich wie jede Trilogy von Artifex Mundi. Meine Liebste bis jetzt, so gut Nightmares from the Deep auch ist.

Klare Spielempfehlung.
Danke fürs Lesen.

30241310.review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

[i]Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] is a 1st person point & click adventure game that contains some  'hidden objects puzzles' and even more other types of puzzles.

Like in the second installment, the hidden objects puzzles usually require a bit more than just clicking on the correct objects: you often need to click on a container to reveal a hidden object or you may need to click on an item to use it on another item in order to produce the hidden object you need. These are small additions to the traditional hidden objects puzzle but it does make them a bit more varied and interesting.

If you don't like hidden objects puzzles, there's an option to replace them with 'pair-matching minigames'. You know, the memory game that requires you to remember what picture is on the bottom side of some cards, in order to eventually click on two identical cards and remove these from the board. The goal is to remove all the cards from the board. Contrary to the second game, there are no Steam Achievements for the pair-matching minigames this time.

[i]Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] only has 11 hidden objects puzzles. That's a lot less than the second installment had, which already had considerably less than the first game in the series.

So this time, you'll be solving a larger variety of puzzles. Of course, there is also the classic exploration and collecting items to use on other items to further the story, like in other point & click adventure games.

[h1]The story[/h1]

The story is a direct continuation of the story from the previous Enigmatis games, so I recommend you do... 

http://store.steampowered.com/app/284750/

http://store.steampowered.com/app/284770

...and play them in order. In this third and final chapter, our detective is still chasing the mysterious preacher with the help of Richard Hamilton, a private investigator she met in the first installment.

The story of the third chapter is only great as a conclusion to the story of the trilogy as a whole. But by itself, the story of [i]Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] isn't that good, really, and it's certainly the weakest of the three games. New players thinking of picking up this third Enigmatis game without playing the prequels shouldn't bother because they will be utterly disappointed. The storyline set up in the previous installments is summarized in [i]The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] but it isn't explained well, so you'll be more confused than anything else. Also, you won't understand the motivation of the two protagonists and the antagonist at all, so you won't feel involved with the story.

[h1]The difficulty and length of the game[/h1]

The way to advance in the game, be it through adventuring or through solving puzzles, is always logical so it's never frustratingly hard. Should you find yourself stumped, there's a hint button that you can press. It will point you to the next point where action is required, or allow you to skip a puzzle altogether.

Most of the puzzles in [i]Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] are fun but a bit easy, which takes away the satisfying feeling of being challenged that the previous two games offered. 

It takes about 7 hours to complete the game. After that, there is a bonus chapter you can play through, which will take you less than an hour.

[h1]On Steam's extra features[/h1]

[i]Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] has 5 Steam Trading Cards. You'll get 3 while running the game.

There are 34 Steam Achievements. The practical and technical problems with the achievements from the second installement are gone (see [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198042646749/recommended/284770]my review of [i]Enigmatis 2: The Mists of Ravenwood[/i][/url] for more on that), so much like in the first game we're left with achievements that motivate the player to not use the hint button, to not just click around like crazy until something happens, and so on. The 'collections' achievements are back, too, but they are a lot more difficult this time around. They are optional, of course, but they add a bit more challenge to the game for those who want the achievements, which is what I think Steam Achievements are supposed to be like.

30063537.review:
This is a genuinely amazing HOG. The story, with all its accouterments, takes a proper leap forward in this one.

Fair warning - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GJRxvWHCwks]video[/url] and paragraph both will have spoilers. So, if Enigmatis 1 had a terrible (typical) HOG excuse plot, while Enigmatis 2 had a fairly engaging story and scenes, occasionally marred by stilted acting and action scenes involving two poser figures being ineptly puppeteered.  Enigmatis 3, meanwhile, has a really solid story, backed by good voice acting and gorgeous scenery. A bit of an Uncharted ripoff, complete with a Tibetan setting, but still. It even had a plot twist I didn't see coming. 

Good puzzles, both in the "proper puzzle" and adventure game sense. The game has enough content that it [b]never reuses HOS'[/b] which I have literally never seen an HOG game do before. The sole (though repeating) adventure game logic issue was with the game insistence that a lighters flame can easily melt metal and ice. 

The deduction board is kinda underused - I think it might not even be mandatory this time around. The detective work you had to do via deductions was fairly neat - poorly implemented in the first game, but just about perfect in the second. Having it as a diversion rather than a core element kinda detracts from the uniqueness. 

The game allows you to fine-tune exactly how quickly you want your hints to recharge, and other common HOG elements - something I advocate including in pretty much every game, yet is very rarely actually done.

[b]Heavily recommended[/b]. If you feel as though you need to catch up to the series, start with Enigmatis 2 - it tells you everything you need to know about 1 without being forced to play it.

29232312.review:
Rozdział zamykający trylogię Enigmatis. Pogoń za kaznodzieją doprowadziła nas do Tybetu, gdzie stoczymy ostatnią walkę.

Akcja rozpoczyna się dość nietypowo, jak na przygodówkę. Scena otwierająca nadawałaby się wręcz na otwarcie filmu/gry akcji. Nie oznacza to jednak, iż będzie nas popędzać czas. Chodzi o dynamikę, z jaką pokazano wydarzenie. Potem gra wraca do utartych schematów, wliczając w to krótką retrospekcję w Maple Creek. Ravenwood zostało tylko we wzmiankach.

Nowym lokacjom nie brakuje uroku (dzięki szczegółowej i ostrzejszej w porównaniu do E2 grafice). Niestety, w przypadku eksploracji zastosowano tu ten sam słaby pomysł, co w Grim Legends 2. Obszar podzielono na zestawy miejsc (średnio po 3), przez co powrót na sam początek (no może niekoniecznie do lecącego samolotu) i dozbieranie brakujących znajdziek nie jest możliwe. Z kolei z Grim Legends 3 wzięto przedmioty, na których można działać w ekwipunku, oraz modyfikowalny poziom trudności. Ciężar rozgrywki coraz bardziej przenosi się na elementy charakterystyczne dla klasycznych przygodówek. Głowy nie dam, czy Enigmatis 3 nie posiada najmniejszej liczby sekwencji hidden object ze wszystkich opisanych przeze mnie gier tego rodzaju. Inna sprawa, że to wrażenie potęgowane jest przez ogólną długość gry. Jest to jeden z krótszych tytułów Artifex Mundi, w jakie grałem.

Do wad zaliczę muzykę, która pomimo dobrego wykonania bywa monotonna i jest jej zwyczajnie mało. Aktorstwo wypadło słabo, nawet jak na taką produkcję. Poziom trudności – nawet na ekspercie problemy rozwiązuje się podejrzanie szybko.

Enigmatis 3 mogę polecić tylko jeśli ktoś: a) szuka naprawdę łatwego klikacza/zapchajdziury do relaksu, b) chciałby koniecznie zobaczyć zakończenie polowania na kaznodzieję (które wrażenia nie robi, mimo usilnych prób wprowadzania zwrotów akcji). Niestety, jako wyrwana z kontekstu gra jest zbyt krótka i zbyt łatwa, by dawać jej szansę z innych powodów. Nawet jeśli kwalifikujemy się do jednej z powyższych grup lepiej poczekać na przecenę. Moja ocena: 3-.

Наконец-то я прошла все 3 части замечательной игры! Это просто шедевр, с затягивающей историей, красивой музыкой и ШИКАРНЫМИ локациями! Но всё по порядку (сразу оговорюсь, это моё мнение, и оно может не совпадать с Вашим):

Плюсы игр (сразу всех 3-х):
+обалденные локации
+интересные головоломки
+мистический сюжет
+харизматичные злодеи Пастор и Ворон. Хотя Пастор мне больше понравился :)
+возможность делать выводы, основанные на дедукции и предположении
+дополнительные мини-истории (которые разблокируются после прохождения основного сюжета)
+широкоформатные обои (жаль, что мало)
+концепт-арты, наброски
+музыка

Но есть и минусы:
-3-я часть постоянно подвисает, хотя первые две идут влёт (читала на форуме, что разработчики в курсе этой проблемы и никак не могут найти, где происходит утечка памяти, обещают пофиксить)
-начиная со второй части детектив постоянно тупит (не могла понять, кто сидит в тюрьме в подземелье парка - хотя сразу можно догадаться, если этот "кто-то" в курсе всех демонических событий тысячелетней давности. Далее, детектив не может узнать своего друга Гамильтона, когда случайно видит его в парке - ну да, кто же ещё может следить за злыми силами кроме неё)
-3-я часть немного не так эпична, как первые две. Да и бой демона и архангела не сильно впечатлил, ожидала большего.

В целом, все три игры получились очень красочные, захватывающие и необычные! Думаю, перепройду все 3 части, и найду все секреты!

28845595.review:
[h1]ZAKOŃCZENIE NIESAMOWITEJ PRZYGODY[/h1]
Dotarliśmy do końca tej cudownej serii jaką jest Enigmatis. Wydawcy kazali nam bardzo długo czekać na koniec trylogii jednak możliwe, że dzięki temu The Shadow of Karkhala jest tak dobrze wykończoną grą.

[h1]OPRAWA GRAFICZNA[/h1]
Według mnie jest to jedna z najładniejszych gier Artifexu. Znajdziemy tutaj wiele bardzo kolorowych lokacji, które można podziwiać na każdym kroku. Każde odwiedzone miejsce zawiera inne elementy niż poprzednia więc nie wpadamy w monotonię i cały czas poznajemy coś nowego. Wszelkie występujące w grze animacje wykonano naprawdę dobrze. Ręcznie rysowana grafika jest naprawdę ogromnym plusem tej produkcji. 

[h1]OPRAWA DŹWIĘKOWA[/h1]
Jest to bardzo dobrze wykonana część gry.  Muzyka zmienia się w zależności od sytuacji więc cały czas w pewnym stopniu manipuluje naszymi odczuciami jednak przeważnie jest ona spokojna oraz relaksująca, krótko mówiąc idealna do odpoczynku po ciężkim dniu.

[h1]FABUŁA[/h1]
Tym razem po katastrofie samolotu trafiamy w ośnieżone góry Karakorum. Odkrywamy tam kompleks świątyń oraz małą dziewczynkę. Oczywiście nie znaleźliśmy się tam przypadkiem, gdyż właśnie w tym miejscu najprawdopodobniej znajduje się zły kaznodzieja znany z poprzednich części Enigmatis, a naszym głównym celem jest powstrzymanie go przed uwolnieniem potężnego demona. Opowiadana historia trzyma w napięciu oraz przez kilka nagłych zwrotów akcji sprawia, że chce się grać. Mamy również do dyspozycji dodatkową przygodę, która wyjaśni co tak naprawdę stało się przed naszym przybyciem.

[h1]ROZGRYWKA[/h1]
Podczas przedzierania się przez kolejne lokacje natkniemy się na wiele łamigłówek oraz scen z ukrytymi obiektami, których rozwiązanie przybliży nas do powstrzymania złego pastora. Na swojej drodze znajdziemy również sporo znajdziek ukrytych praktycznie na widoku ( jak wiadomo jest to najlepsze miejsce aby coś schować :). Poziom trudności zagadek jest bardzo dobrze dopasowany więc przechodząc przez kolejne etapy odczuwamy sporą satysfakcję.

[h1]PODSUMOWUJĄC[/h1]
Enigmatis 3 w świetnym stylu kończy niesamowitą przygodę z jaką przyszło nam się zmierzyć. Szeroko rozumiana oprawa jak zawsze stoi na bardzo wysokim poziomie. Każdy znajdzie poziom trudności dopasowany do swoich preferencji.

[h1]DLA TYCH, KTÓRZY NIE LUBIĄCZYTAĆ[/h1]
+ Ręcznie rysowana grafika
+ Dodatkowa przygoda
+ Doskonałe udźwiękowienie
+ Zakończenie serii w świetnym stylu
+ Wciągająca opowieść
+ Łamigłówki oraz sceny z ukrytymi obiektami
+ Dobrze wyważone poziomy trudności
+ Sporo przedmiotów kolekcjonerskich

Jedynym minusem jest to, że mamy do czynienia z ostatnią częścią tej wspaniałej serii.

Jeżeli moja recenzja pomogła Ci przy podjęciu decyzji nad zakupem, będę wdzięczny jeśli ją ocenisz/skomentujesz, co jest dla mnie ogromną motywacją do pracy nad kolejnymi tekstami.

28626588.review:
Recommended.

As the last chapter in the Enigmatis trilogy, this wraps up all the loose ends. That in itself makes this game satisfying as you finally find out what happens to our protagonist and her friends and enemies alike. This installment still manages to twist and turn the story to keep you interested. Some scenes do seem a bit similar to the previous games but not enough to bother too much.

I must say that I actually enjoyed the characters and their interactions. The characters have CHARACTER, they aren't there to just help you along. Especially after three games, I've grown quite fond of some characters. I doubt that the personalities leave you completely disinterested - at least, not all of them.

The snowy backgrounds still bring out a lot of colorful locations. Actually, the colors stand out even more because of it. The scenery of the game isn't as dark as in the previous ones, which may put off some people. I personally liked it, not just because I like colorful backgrounds but because it symbols the end of this journey. As for the animation, I have mixed feelings about it. I liked how the art seemed even more realistic, especially when it came to the humans. They still didn't change their expressions that much to show how they felt.

Gameplay was a bit frustrating. If you play to get all the achievements in one go, you must be extra careful or you might miss something. I had to restart the game many times because I kept forgetting to pick white feathers or morphing objects that I didn't have any access to once I realized my mistake. Luckily, if you miss few feathers at the beginning of the game and you restart it, you can get the achievement quite easily.

In the end, I enjoyed this game and the journey from the first to the last installment. Especially since I managed to get all to achievements after such difficulty and was left satisfied. This series is a great add to the collection of any hidden object gamers, new and old. Whether you buy it on sale or not, it's worth it.

28309214.review:
A fairly faint positive recommendation, mostly for the sake of completing the trilogy.
As the game is the 3rd in the series, I have no doubt that readers have reference points about previous ones  so I'll be short with the review.
The game wraps up the story fairly well, even though the ending is quite lacking after the 1st game's eerie atmosphere and the 2nd one's bleakness. The third game lost it's Enigmatis-identity, the gameplay turned into the standard, superlinear, non-backtraceable HOG as most of the games are, while the predecessors had a fixed location and gave more and more access of it's buildings, parts and such. The hidden object scenes are littered with objects that require more than one - often 3+ - actions to do, in one case it was 6! This halts the gameplay, and in the meanwhile I think the animation quality also dropped.
All in all, it's an okay game by Mundi standards, but in my book this is the weakest game from the series - lack of a consistant area and therefore the constant moving forward-forward-forward made the game much less of an investigative one. Would worth to pick up during sales or from a bundle to finish the story, but it could have been so much more.

28107529.review:
[b]In a nutshell:[/b] A worthy end to the Enigmatis trilogy. It has its flaws, but the presentation and gameplay is thoroughly enjoyable and on par with the rest of the series.

If you haven't played the previous two Enigmatis games (Maple Creek and Ravenwood), I highly suggest doing that first, because the story in Karkhala begins a few days after the Ravenwood adventure ends, and some of the details and subtle nods to the earlier games will make a lot more sense. 

For achievement hunters, there's no need to plan for the usual "1.5 playthroughs". The pair matching achievements are in-game only.

[h1]Story/Presentation[/h1]
I won't cover the basics, because it's a direct continuation of the overarching series plot. The main characters are the same and the focus is once again on finding and stopping the Preacher at all costs.

The setting is the most drastic change, taking place in the Himalayas. I gotta say, compared to the haphazard way many HOPAs handle foreign settings (looking at you, Tibetan Quest), the culture is presented pretty well. The devs clearly did their homework, which makes a big difference regarding immersion. It's refreshing to not see stereotypical "runes" as a stand-in for the regional writing/language, or artifacts and artwork that don't match the local flavor. Some things are indeed a bit westernized, but I suppose that's to be expected for the genre. I'd have liked to see more interaction with local people instead of focusing on an American research expedition, but it was well done nonetheless. There was also a bit of tongue-in-cheek humor with the research team all butchering Fang's name, while your character is the only one who pronounces it correctly.

If you're the type to watch cutscenes, the pacing and exposition are pretty good. There were a couple of unexpected (yet decently-spaced) twists to ramp up the drama as well. The ending felt a little rushed (defeat the bad guy, look wistfully into the sunset, roll credits), but there's more substance to it than in similar titles. The bonus chapter is good too, which is a rarity in itself.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
I was caught off guard by this game. After the intro cutscene it [i]immediately[/i] throws you into a pseudo-action sequence that gives you no time to think before getting sucked into the story. There are a few other active sequences further into the game, which I found to be a surprisingly nice change of pace. There are no actual fail states of course, but the tiny adrenaline rush they provide is just enough to pull you into a deeper level of immersion.

I didn't run into any bugs or hangups in puzzles, but the latter half of the game was plagued with abnormally long loading screens. I didn't think there was anything to really justify that much lag between scenes and puzzles, and based on other reviews it seems I'm not the only one who noticed them. Thankfully the only spot where it actively messed with a spoken line (for me at least) was more toward the end, so nothing important was missed. But other than adding some extra waiting time, they didn't interfere with gameplay.

[h1]Sound & Graphics[/h1]
The soundwork in this is by far the best in the series. The VOs were excellent as usual. (It sounded like they had a different actor voicing Rick than in the first two games, though I could be wrong about that.) 

The music was particularly good, and never subtly repetitive or annoying like certain themes in titles like Nightmares From the Deep. Though the last two stations on the car radio are songs from the previous games, so they're a little on the grating side. The Extras section lets you save the music files, but I really wish they offered the flute title song (or any of the flute songs) as a download, because those were fantastic.

Graphics-wise? Come on, it's an Artifex Mundi game. "Gorgeous" is just a side note. It may not be one of their spam-your-screenshot-key titles, but the artistry still oozes out of the screen.

[h1]Puzzles & HOGs[/h1]
Not too easy, not too difficult, and tweaked/varied enough to not feel like yet another shameless rehash of the typical puzzles in these games. If you're colorblind you should know that while there's a hell of a lot of reliance on color, there's also a more-than-usual emphasis on pattern/shape and texture, which might make up for it.

The HOGs are good, but I hesitate to vomit praise all over them. There were no ESL errors that I can recall (even in the bonus chapter!), but certain isolated clutter piles seemed a little unpolished or low quality, to the point where I couldn't tell what some of the clutter actually [i]was[/i]. That made finding certain types of items (unlabeled bottles or small containers, for instance) needlessly difficult. Plus a handful of items were almost entirely hidden behind other things, so instead of looking for the actual item you'd be hunting for something that looks like a piece of it (edge of a binocular eyepiece, corner of a book, etc). I wouldn't say that detracted from enjoying the HOGs themselves, but it wasn't the same level of 'wow' as the rest of the game. They were more or less forgettable compared to the puzzles.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[i]Shadow of Karkhala[/i] is a great end to the fantastic Enigmatis trilogy. It can easily be played and enjoyed on its own merit, but I recommend playing the first two games in order to get the most out of the story. If you've already played them, you probably don't even need to be reading this right now. 

TL;DR: It's worth your time. Enjoy.

A magnífica saga dos ceifeiros chega a seu final de modo surpreendente, Emigmatis 3 foi ainda melhor do que eu esperava em muitos aspectos, apenas achei os puzzles muito mais fáceis do que nos outros dois capítulos.
A longa caçada ao Pregador leva nossos protagonistas até Karkhala a história então se encerra com o desenrolar de uma batalha entre Anjo e Demônio. 
Sobre o jogo em si, ótima jogabilidade e inovando mais que os outros dois agora você tem que procurar objetos em algumas situações onde a ação ainda está se desenrolando. Volta o sistema de dedução que lhe permite obter uma idéia do que investigar a seguir. Puzzels mais simples que nos outros jogos e já os quebra cabeças de objetos ocultos estão com uma dificuldade um pouco maior, fugindo do óbvio objetos soterrados por inúmeros outros na grande maioria deles. Realmente com algumas idéias bem originais.
Música simples mas agradável já os gráficos se superam, continuam os cenários belíssimos pintados à mão mas agora há um tratamento muito mais realístico aos personagens e como eles se mesclam aos fundos.

Enigmatic é a melhor série da Artiflex até agora. 

Nota Ohadez 9/10

Bonjour à tous les amis,

Concernant Enigmatis 3: L'ombre de Karkhala,

Magnifique ! Un troisième épisode génial avec une histoire toujours aussi excellente qui s'accorde très bien avec les précédentes. Cette fois encore Sarah va vivre une aventure palpitante pleine d'embuches et de mystères.

Sublime graphiquement avec des décors superbes, des effets au top ainsi que des animations de qualités. 

La série Enigmatis est pour moi l'une des meilleures de toute la collection et ce 3eme épisode le confirme. Artifex nous sort là le top en matière de jeu d'objets cachés avec tout pleins de nouvelles choses a faire et ce place encore comme le maitre dans ce domaine.

Pour ma part énorme pouce bleu, je le conseille a tous, aux petits comme aux grands, Enigmatis 3: L'ombre de Karkhala est excellent avec des puzzles toujours aussi bons et des SOC superbes, je conseille aussi de faire les 2 premiers avant pour mieux comprendre l'histoire même si cela n'est pas indispensable. En tout cas encore bravo a Artifex pour ce petit bijou.

Voilà j'espère que cette évaluation vous aidera, je vous invite a rejoindre mon groupe [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamsurprisefr] Steam Jeux Surprise [/url] ou vous y trouverez des descriptifs plus élaborés de joueurs sur les jeux Steam ainsi que tout pleins de bonne choses.

Wer die ersten beiden »Enigmatis«-Spiele mochte, der wird dieses hier ebenfalls mögen. Man konnte zwar darüber hinweg sehen, doch auf Dauer war es schon ein wenig nervig.
Ansonsten wie gesagt ein sehr gutes Spiel. An manchen Stellen sticht es für mich heraus, da es durchaus auch etwas »erwachsener« aufgebaut ist, als die meisten Wimmelbild-Spiele die ich kenne. Alles in allem ein gelungener Abschluss dieser Geschichte und eine klare Empfehlung für jeden, der ein Spiel für zwischendurch sucht und der Point&Click und Wimmelbildspielen etwas abgewinnen kann.

25348265.review:
Je tu závěr trilogie Enigmatis od bohů HOG žánru Artifex Mundi. Povedlo se naplnit vysoká očekávání a přinést uspokojivý konec?

[h1]Cesta ke třetímu dílu[/h1]
Žánr hledání skrytých objektů zažívá právě díky polským vývojářům Artifex Mundi na Steamu žně. Už to jsou tři roky, co přišli s prvním dílem série Nightmares a ukázali všem, že tyto odpočinkové hry mají své místo i na této platformě. Brzy poté začali chrlit svá díla, mezi nimiž vynikalo Enigmatis 2. Hra to byla úžasná, obsahovala pár detektivních prvků, které nebyly v žádném jiném titulu a zápletka byla vskutku zajímavá a udržela vás až do konce.

Brzy poté se na Steam dostavil i první díl, který vyšel později než druhý, protože se musel předělat z jiného enginu. Vše ale dopadlo dobře a i když měl titul pár chyb, stále dokázal najít své místo mezi těmi kvalitnějšími počiny.

Trvalo dlouho, než vyšel závěr trilogie. Mezitím jsem zahrál a dohrál jiné série a dokonce i HOG hry od jiných tvůrců a i připadalo mi, jako by se občas vývojáři báli vydat se do neprozkoumaných končin a dát do svých her něco, čím by se lišili výrazně od konkurence. V tomhle ohledu mě velmi příjemně překvapila hra 9 Clues 2, která byla temnější, depresivnější a po právu usedla na trůn nejlepší HOG hry, jakou jsem kdy měl tu čest hrát.

[h1]Hurá, novinky[/h1]
Enigmatis 3 vám už v prvních minutách ukáže, že tohle bude velkolepé dobrodružství. Podobně jako závěr trilogie Nightmares, i zde vás hra vtáhne do děje téměř okamžitě a vy tak prvních pár minut ani nedýcháte napětím, jak tohle dopadne.

A co víc, Enigmatis 3 přináší do žánru HOG tolik novinek, až jsem z toho pomalu křičel nadšením. První, na kterou narazíte, je nastavení vaší vlastní obtížnosti. Uznávám, že tohle není zas taková novinka a viděl jsem ji už třeba u série New York Mysteries, ale to také není hra od AM, že. Další, tentokrát opravdu výrazným novým prvkem v hratelnosti jsou předměty a jejich úpravy. Občas najdete věc, u které uvidíte malé plus. Onen předmět můžete dále prozkoumat a můžete jej nějak upravit (klasicky svítilna a z ní vyjmout baterky a dát tam pak nové).

Aby toho nebylo málo, dočkali jsme se i menší změny v chodu hry. Jde to vidět na úplném začátku, kdy se hra přepíná z videa přímo do části, kdy máte vy udělat pár úkonů, jen aby se opět přepnula zpátky do videa. Bohužel se mi to v této části trošku sekalo, ale myslím, že pokud na tom tvůrci zapracují, bude to parádní oživení.

[h1]Závěr trilogie[/h1]
Jelikož je tohle třetí díl trilogie, je vcelku jasné, že tak nějak bude navazovat na předchozí dva díly. Sledujete hlavního záporáka přezdívaného kazatel, který chce ovládnout svět a tak dále. Příběh, ač klišé, budete sledovat s napětím. A i když vám bude jasné, jak to dopadne, dočkáte se pár zvratů, při kterých budete jen tupě zírat na obrazovku a hltat dění na ní. Příběh je tedy jedním z hlavních tahounů hry, to ale není překvapením, protože v Artifex Mundi prostě umí parádně vyprávět.

Enigmatis 3 si samozřejmě ponechalo i hlavní devizu série, tedy ono vyšetřování. Nečekejte ale žádné obtížné hádanky. Hra je dostupná i nehráčům, tudíž tu spojíte pouze pár důkazů, hlavní postava pronese monolog a to je vše.

[h1]Stará dobrá hratelnost[/h1]
Jinak tu víceméně zůstalo vše při starém, což je ale dobře. Nemá cenu měnit něco, co prostě tak výborně funguje. Během hraní narazíte na pár postav, které se vám budou snažit pomoct, ale je jasné, že většina práce stejně zůstane na vašich bedrech. Budete tak hledat předměty, díky kterým budete odemykat hádanky, zpřístupňovat si další místa a celkově se snažit dostat kupředu na místo, kde je nejspíše i hlavní záporák.

Artifex Mundi jako první předvedlo funkci, kdy si místo hledání skrytých předmětů můžete vybrat i jinou minihru. A zde je tomu nejinak. Pokud neradi hledáte věci rozmístěné na obrazovce, můžete přepnout do módu, kdy hledáte páry. Je to takové pexeso a je to zábava.

Kromě toho tu jsou také minihry, kterých je tu celkem dost, což je jen a jen dobře. Kromě těch, které už znáte z několika jiných her tu jsou totiž i novinky. A můžu říct, že jsou opravdu úžasné a parádně sedí do celkového zasazení tohoto díla. Hodně se mi líbilo stoupání na vrchol hory, kdy vám hra ukazuje fragmenty hory a vy je musíte najít a díky tomu se dostáváte výš a výš. Celková náročnost hádanek je bohužel v rozmezí dětsky lehké až lehké, takže nehrozí žádné záseky. Pokud by se ale tak stalo, je tu tlačítko nápověda či přeskočení, které onen problém vyřeší a vy se tak můžete kochat prostředím bez nějaké té frustrace.

[h1]Výlet do hor[/h1]
A věřte, že je čím se kochat. Zprvu jsem měl strach, protože ona výrazná stylizace mi připadala mimo a já si říkal, že to byl krok vedle. Jenže tomu tak vůbec není a právě grafická stránka hry je to, co vám mnohdy vykouzlí úsměv na tváři nebo budete zírat s otevřenými ústy na tu nádheru. Já sám odolával pokušení neustále mačkat F12, abych zachytil onen moment, onu překrásnou scenérii, která mi učarovala. Bohužel kvalita některých animací je o trochu horší, ale to je věc, kterou tomuto dílu prominu.

No a pak tu máme hudební podkres a kvalitu dabingu, respektive celkově i dialogů. To vše je, jak už je u Artifex Mundi tradičně zvykem, na velmi vysoké úrovni a myslím, že tu není ani co vytknout.

[h1]Každý by chtěl víc[/h1]
Vše dobré bohužel jednou skončí a u téhle hry se dostaví konec vcelku brzy. Po 4 hodinách jsem spatřil závěrečné titulky a bylo mi k pláči. Poté jsem si zahrál ještě doplňkové dobrodružství, které je vcelku dobré, ale po třiceti minutách je konec. Naštěstí tu máte i tři druhy věcí na sbírání, tudíž vám Enigmatis 3 vydrží o něco déle. A jelikož je tohle speciální edice, máte tu i věci přístupné z menu, jako jsou: tapety, hudbu, videa, minihry, HOG a další.

Vyplatí se tedy pořídit si tuhle hru? Ano. Dokonce bych se nebál říct, že si ji můžete koupit i za plnou cenu, která činí osm euro a nebudete zklamáni.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ zajímavý příběh a parádní ukončení trilogie
+ úžasná hratelnost
+ nové druhy hádanek
+ tak akorát počet HOG miniher
+ hra dobře odsýpá
+ audiovizuální zpracování
+ hromada bonusových věcí

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- hra mohla být delší
- hádanky jsou až příliš jednoduché

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 10/10[/b]

Už jsem hrál přes 30 HOG her a věřte, že série Enigmatis patří zcela zaslouženě mezi špičku. Třetí díl oživuje zatuchlý žánr a přináší do něj svěží vítr s novinkami, díky kterým vás toto dílo bude bavit ještě více. K tomu si přičtěte i výborný příběh, hratelnost, grafiku a hudbu a je tu něco, na co jen tak nezapomenete.

25191499.review:
The Shadow of Karkhala is the 3rd and final part of the Enigmatis story line. The main game is a point & click adventure, but combined with 3 types of sub-games. First there are puzzles, which are usually not too difficult to solve. Second there are the hidden object games, where you need to find a list of objects in a single scene. And third, a simple pairing game if you don't like to find the hidden objects. I always plays these games on the most difficult level to at least have some challenges.
This is one of the most beautiful HOPA (hidden object puzzle adventure) out there on Steam! If you're new to this game genre, give this a try. Not a must-play game, but quite entertaining. The voice acting can be cheesy at times, but hey, this is casual gaming!
Admittedly, I found this game feeling alot shorter than the first two games in the Enigmatis trilogy.

Score: 8/10

Pro: 
+ nice graphics
+ steady game progress
+ thrilling story
+ additional bonus story

Contra:
- feels shorter than previous 2 games...
- HOPA = no replayability

25160272.review:
Why didn't I play the game when I bought it? It was Olympics Games time. But I don't regret delaying my pleasure.

Enigmatis 3 is concluding the hunt for the evil Priest initiated in Maple Creek and pursued in Ravenwood. Rick and you are nearing to stop the madman, however, you don't know his next destination. Returning at Maple Creek, you find that the Priest is interested in a mountain village, in the Himalaya...

The story is full of twists and I liked it. There is no major plotholes and why I wish that some stuff turned differently, it was satisfying enough. As Artifex Mundi is rarely ending their games on a tragic note, Enigmatis is also ending positively. However, that being said isn't revealing who survives and who does not.

The gameplay is quite standard: find items, use them, combine them, solve puzzles and clear hidden objects scenes. However, you have some actions moments (like firing your revolver, avoid falling from the plane, climbing up a mountain, etc..) and that's very refreshing. Everything is quite easy and I must say that I was happy to avoid puzzles frying my brains. The Evidence Deduction is also back: you find evidence and then it's up to you to place them in the right circle which is a question. That gameplay was used in Maple Creek to help you remember your investigation there following the memory loss and in Ravenwood to help you find why a beast was interested in a little girl.

I also liked the fact that you can interact with some objects, like the radio in the car, to choose your own music. It's perhaps not something often in the game but I find these little interactions very nice.

The graphics are quite good, I loved them. The fact that you're in an Eastern setting is also nice, even if you're not really confronted to it all along (as you have also the portion in Maple Creek and in the archaeological crew camp). But what I liked the most is the soundtrack, very fitting. I loved the menu track, played directly by the little girl with her flute.

Enigmatis 3 is wonderfully concluding the trilogy. It's a must-have for anyone that liked Enigmatis or Artifex Mundi's work. The whole trilogy is marvelous and I'm sad to see that there will no more (though the gameplay will probably end in another game). It's like Nightmares from the Deep or Time Enigma: you're very sad to leave behind you a wonderful universe.

25099708.review:
Game Mechanics:
This game offers the same sort of logic puzzles and hidden-object-scenes as the previous two, but now in a mountainregion.

Plot:
This game is supposed to wrap up the Enigmatis-trilogy, both its lore and its contemporary conclusion, and it does so nicely. The characters you met in the other two games are back for the ride, but you don't need to have played them to get started (as you get a quick summary of the previous two games in the opening scenes).

Presentation:
This is by far the best looking and best sounding game in the trilogy, as is to be expected, though the mountain-setting is quite a different perspective from the other two.

Completion:
Definite yes, especially if you've played the other two. This game should probably only take two playthroughs to complete, with the first one being the longest and the second one to wrap up loose ends.

25047156.review:
Unsatisfying conclusion to an otherwise satisfying series. 

The heroine of Enigmatic returns with exactly what she needed most: another head injury. The other ones she got were late in the game.

Cool Stuff:
* It was obvious that the budget for animation went through the roof, by far the prettiest game in the trilogy. 
* You get a buddy to help you move and lift things and interact with puzzles.
* Have a cell phone to take pictures with so you don't leave evidence and conclusions where anyone can just get at it and muck it up (is this woman actually a detective tho? Like, how with the international juristiction??) so that's an upgrade all around. 
* There were a variety of puzzles.
* Detective had a lot less head injuries this game than others, so she made deductions a lot faster.

Problems: 
* The Asmodai v. Raphael story was told so many times in so many ways this game that I was ready to burn the monastary down.
* there were some bugs. At once point I used the hint button and it kept redirecting me to look at this broken lighter I had already checked, three puzzles before I had anything to fix it with. Also the back/direction arrows weren't as clear this game.
* The ending. The first two games ended spectacularly, a cliffhanger that felt conclusive - like there wouldn't be other games. But there were more games. And the ending on this one? For both the main game AND the side story were just downers. 
* The continuity between the side story and the main game was broken by a few scenes which were unnecessarily different
* Those pictures of Brittany in CG glory next to real-life children.


If you're dying to know what happens in the end of this trilogy, then I'd say play this game. The story isn't that amazing, but the puzzles are pretty good and the graphics fun to look at.

25039875.review:
Buen final para una de las mejores, sino la mejor, saga del genero de objetos ocultos. 
 
Desde que aparecio el primer Enigmatis en el 2011 hasta ahora los desarolladores, Artifex Mundi, han mejorado mucho. Cada vez presenta juegos con un mejor acabado artistico, una mayor atencion al detalle y sobre todo mas divertidos. 

Y vale que el genero de objetos ocultos es un genero menor, muy casual y sencillo... pero eso no quita para que las cosas se hagan bien y la saga Enigmatis hace las cosa muy, pero que muy bien.

Esta tercera parte, presumiblemente la ultima, es mas trepidante, mas intuitiva y mas espectacular que las anteriores entregas... pero que en terminos generales considero que es un poco inferior a la excelente y soberbia Enigmatis 2, para mi el mejor juego del genero que he jugado hasta la fecha. 

Artifex Mundi esta evolucionando y Enigmatis ha evolucionado con ellos. Los puzzles, siendo muy faciles como siempre, son mas interesantes y estan mejor integrados en el juego. Cada vez prestan mas atencion a la trama, los giros inesperados y a la espectacularidad de lo que acontece. 

Todo un acierto del juego y todo un goze para el jugador. 

Juego, y saga al completo, mas que recomendable para todos a los gusten de las aventuras bien hechas y divertidas, ya sean sencillas o no. 



7/10

25019075.review:
Magiczna wizualna oprawa, śliczne, aczkolwiek nieco podobne do siebie ścieżki dźwiękowe, ciekawa, logicznie poprowadzona fabuła, postacie, do których można poczuć nutkę sympatii... Z tego powodu tę grę kupiłam i to właśnie otrzymałam. Dobre, ciekawe "prawie pięć godzin" różnorodnej rozgrywki nie znużyło mnie - za to zachwyciło.

Mogłabym poskarżyć się tylko na zagadki i przerywniki filmowe. Moim zdaniem łamigłówki, chociaż różne, pasujące i różnorodne, były nieco... Łatwe. Miałam problem tylko z dwoma, i to z prozaicznych problemów (raz rozwiązywałam jedną w złym momencie rozgrywki, raz nie zrozumiałam o co chodzi w minigierce). Więcej męczyłam się przez nieuwagę i "niedomyślność" w stosowaniu niekórych przedmiotów niż łamigłówki. Przerywniki za to dalej genialne nie są. Raz postaciom stało się coś złego z twarzami i wyglądali jak brzuchomówcy... Jakość nieco słaba... Jednak nie dla filmików tę grę kupiłam, więc to niewielki mankament i raczej nie psuł mi zabawy.

Mówiąc szczerze od początku nastawiałam się na nieco mroczniejszy klimat, jak w poprzednich częściach i początku z "Maple Creek". Troszkę rozczarowała mnie baśniowa oprawa wizualna. No dobrze, nie wszędzie tak było, a i trupów leżało mnóstwo. Ale z jakiegoś powodu może tylko ja tak to odebrałam.

Plusy za logiczne używanie przedmiotów. Czasem coś tam w tym względzie psułam, bo trochę młoda, niedoświadczona i niedomyślna jestem, ale przynajmniej nic nie brało się raczej od tak, "z powietrza".

Dziękuję twórcom za dobrą zabawę!

24944988.review:
The galvanizing action packed conclusion of the Enigmatis series begins only a few weeks after the last clash with the Reapers, the Raven and the Preacher.  Though this concluding chapter is stand alone due the private investigator's narrative recap of previous events and the retelling of Reaper history, if one has played the first two installments there is an innate impatient enthusiatic eagerness to track the Preacher down and finish this battle of wit, perseverence, and destiny - decisively.  In the end there can be only one - the Preacher, is the last Reaper alive, and ultimately either evil, destruction and mass death will be released back into the world in the form of the demon Asmosdai or the tenacious private investigators will stop it.      

Storyline: A few weeks after the events in the American redwood forest tourist park Ravenwood where the Preacher defeated the Raven to become the last Reaper alive, our private investigator is back on his trail.  She knows now that there is only one Reaper left alive, and that the final Reaper's last and only duty is to sacrifice his life to resurrect his master, the demon Asmodai, bringer of destruction and death.  Now teamed up with another private investigator, Rick Hamilton, who for 20+ years has been tracking the Preacher and wants revenge, she begins at Maple Creek where her harrowing destiny began approximately two years before.  She must find where the last Reaper, the Preacher, has gone and stop him at all costs.  She and Rick journey to the highlands of the Himalayas after deducing the Preacher's destination, Karkhala Mountain, to stop his nefarious evil plan of ressurecting the demon Asmodai.  Along the way they encounter a scientistic team investigating an ancient monastery and discover an equally ancient group of Chosen guardians just as dedicated to stopping the rise of the demon Asmodai as they are.  Mystery, adventure, intrigue, betrayal, and murder are all part of this legendary battle between the arch-angel Raphael and the three-headed demon Asmodai.

Gameplay: Smooth combination of point and click, hidden object puzzles (HOPs), mini-games and interactive game play.  Stunning artwork with a vivid pastel pallette, 3D elements (title screen, snow and blowing wind), and a fast travel map. A prequel bonus chapter about Brittany and an extra menu with replayable HOPs, mini-games, cutscene videos, wallpapers, music, etc. 3 sets of extra hidden objects: 21 morphing Tainted spirits (look like evil skeleton ghosts or balls of mist), 15 Feathers and 8 Flowers. As usual with Artifex Mundi there is an alternative matching game if one does not want to play the HOPs.  For achievement hunters: all achievements can be earned in a single playthrough. Yeah! 

Return of the evidence board:  This unique and exclusive feature of the Enigmatis series would have been missed had it been eliminated.  Part of the fun of this game (and the series) is finding the evidence and piecing it together much like a real investigator would.  The evidence board, now located in her cellphone, uses the pictures she takes and places them on this internal evidence board and is used for deducing answers to the relative and important questions of the investigation.  For those new to this series the evidence board will be an interesting mini-game puzzle whose clues will piece together the mystery.  For those who have played this series before the evidence board seems a bit weak since most of the mystery is known or can be guessed/ deduced very quickly.  There is a twist or two so do not count it out.

Hidden Object puzzles:  3 different kinds.  Finding a item within a picture, Find assembly pieces, and the majority are very interactive list finds.  The interactive list finds require the player not only to open drawers, jars, cabinets, etc. but in many cases to assembly the find clue such as putting wings on a statue or assemblying something that requires more than one piece.  Adds to the difficulty a little bit but the interaction is fun since the player needs to figure out what needs to be done to create the list find.  It is almost a mini-game Hidden Object puzzle.  Quite fun and unique.

Plus I swear the difficulty level slowly rises throughout the game since the last couple of list finds were tough.  Either that or someone spiked the difficulty level at the end.  Either way the last couple of HOPs are quite the challenge. My head scratcher was when the camera equipment fell all over the floor.  I am sure my difficulty came from the fact I had no clue what half the word finds actually were.  I know now since I had to look them up to figure out what the things were I was looking for.  Not often I run into such a head scratcher, and I am by no means putting that down.  I enjoy a good challenge and learning something new while doing it is always a bonus.  

Mini-games and puzzles: Mazes, logical, matching, recipe and a balancing act while crossing a downed tree.  Mostly standard types of puzzles but fun and well intergrated into the story line.  

This leads us to what I call interactive game play.  The puzzle mini-games in most cases are so well intergrated in the storyline the mini-game is no longer separated from the point and click elements.  The best example of this is crossing a tree log like a tight rope walker.  It is a mini-game but it is also direct storyline as well.  There are other interactive puzzles like moving a chest about to use as a climbing surface (not a mini-game or even point and click).  The line between actual mini-game and the point and click "puzzles" has been blurred in such a fashion that gameplay has become interactive. Very nice and quite inventive since the player for the most part really does not stop and think "oh this is a puzzle".  It is that smooth.   

I think I covered everthing.  Highly recommend even if one has not played this series before.  It is stand alone and everything is explained.  For those who have been following the series this is a MUST OWN game.  The INTERACTIVE boss battle at the end is epic.  Worth full price.

Para mim, a  "cereja do bolo" desta série. Desde a cena pós créditos da segunda parte da trilogia, esperei ansiosamente pela conclusão épica da história. Se você não jogou os dois primeiros jogos da trilogia, pare o que está fazendo agora e os jogue para não ficar perdido neste último. As cutscenes são para mim a melhor parte do jogo, parece até que estou vendo um filme! Os minijogos até que foram fáceis, já que tenho um pouco de experiência em HOGs, mas podem ser desafiantes para quem nunca jogou jogos desse tipo. Esse jogo só reforça a qualidade excelente que a Artifex Mundi coloca em seus jogos de HO, que até agora não vi em outros HOGs que joguei. Finalizando, este é um título que todo gamer casual deve ter na sua bliblioteca de jogos.

Nota: 10/10

English:

For me, the "icing on the cake" of this series. Since the post credits scene of the second part of the trilogy, I waited anxiously for the epic conclusion of the story. If you have not played the first two games of the trilogy, stop what you're doing now and throw them not to get lost in this latest. The cutscenes are for me the best part of the game, it seems like I'm watching a movie! The minigames until they were easy, since I have a little experience in HOGs, but can be challenging for those who have never played games of this type. This game only reinforces the excellent quality that Artifex Mundi puts in their HO games, which so far have not seen in other HOGS I played. Finally, this is a title that every casual gamer must have in your game library.

Rate: 10/10

+ relaxing

[b]CONS:[/b]

24842623.review:
先前最期待的就是《恐怖传奇3》，后来《恐怖传奇3》出了，就开始期待《乌鸦森林之谜3》了。现在终于上市而且通关了，感觉人生很美满。
由于在推出3的同时推出了捆绑包，如果先前已经买过1和2，现在通过捆绑包来买3的话，会比直接买3便宜几块钱。话说steam上的《乌鸦森林之谜1》的封面被修正了，中国区之前一直是日版封面，然后前几天时候发现改成了中文封面。他还能记得给改回来，真感动……
这是Artifex家的第二部以天朝为背景的解谜游戏，上一部是《西藏冒险》，是在西藏那边；然后这部是在昆仑山那边，我地理不好，昆仑山应该是在新疆西藏那边吧？然后游戏内好像也还是以藏族文化为主。不过比起《西藏冒险》中充满了意义不明的简体汉字、青瓦红墙的中原建筑、还有乱入的日本武士等，《乌鸦森林之谜3》就严谨的多。虽然我并不是很了解藏族文化，但我能感觉到这部游戏还是做过功课的，除了藏族人民的英语仍旧好的出奇以及那个白翅膀的西方大天使以外似乎没什么问题了……
[h1] 画面	[/h1]
画面非常精致美丽，有几个地方可以截下来当壁纸。
人物的五官动作还算自然，但是有时候人物的脑袋晃动的很奇怪，像是脖子断掉了似得。总之就是感觉做的不如2代好。
过场动画质量不错，但是前期每次放完过场动画之后都要卡那么一下才会回到操作界面，不知道为啥。而且比起2代操作界面和过场动画之间无缝链接（我词穷，不知如何表达），3代就链接的没那么自然。
[h1] BGM	[/h1]
笛子声真是太美了……除了笛子以外，其他的BGM也还不错，而且有一两首有一点点前代的旋律。游戏的BGM可以导出，不过似乎并没有那首笛子……而其他几首虽然还不错，但还没美到想让人导出来单曲循环的份上。
[h1] 系统[/h1]
这部的难度选择中也有一个“自定义”难度，可以自己设定提示冷却时间及跳过按钮充能等。最近的这几部新作品都有自定义难度，也许以后的新作也都会有了。
这代也沿袭了前两代的证物推理系统。不过这次的证物不再是放在板子或者墙上了，这次是直接用手机拍，然后在手机上排列证物照片来推理。（而且从外观来看这手机似乎是个爱疯……）
这部与上部一样，也有在场景内收集物品的系统。上部是收集幻象和蝴蝶，这部是收集幻象、花和羽毛。而且比起上部，这部的收集品藏的非常好，与环境融为一体，贼难找。我废了很大的劲结果也一种都没找全，当然也可能是因为我瞎。
这部也可以直接在口袋中加工或合成道具，不用再跑到特定地点加工了。看来《恐怖传奇3》开了个好头啊。不过这部并没有像《恐怖传奇3》一样有可以翻转查看的物品。
然后游戏的主菜单和《恐怖传奇3》一样，前景和背景都会随着鼠标的移动而移动。我个人不喜欢这个设定，晃来晃去总觉得晕……
这一部的笔记本上也只有“目标”而没有剧情笔记了。不知道从什么时候起游戏内就都没有剧情笔记了……估计是因为现在快餐时代人心浮躁，没有几个人会去看剧情笔记了吧。
这部的物品在使用时左上角都会有一个箭头，并且在移至可以使用的地方时物品不再会发光放大。不过在寻物谜题内物品组合时在能够使用物品的地方物品还是会发光放大。
[h1] 寻物谜题[/h1]
这部的寻物谜题感觉难度不低，而且并不是因为翻译错误的原因。需要组合的物品非常多，而且因为技术的提高，需要寻找的物品不再突兀地浮在图层表面，能很好地融入画面里，这相当于也加大了难度。
[h1] 小游戏[/h1]
这部的小游戏整体难度并不高，我这么低的智商都能全部不跳过。小游戏穿插合理，而且也不仅仅是解机关或者配药，种类蛮丰富的，乐趣也不低。
[h1] 成就[/h1]
这部的成就和2代一样，不是以列表形式，而是以场景装饰物的形式展现。但是因为同时有要求玩配对游戏的成就和全寻物谜题不提示的成就，所以想要全成就就必须至少二周目。而且寻找全部收集品的成就也不好搞。
不过似乎并没有要求专家模式通关的成就，所以因为自定义难度的存在，二周目三周目刷成就应该还是比较便捷的。
[h1] 细节[/h1]
写评测的时候突然发现商店页面里的宣传截图居然是中文版的！好像Artifex家其他解谜游戏的宣传截图都是英文的，只有这部是中文的。
标题画面吹笛子的小女孩我盯着看了会，虽然我不懂长笛，但小女孩的手指的确在按照长笛的音来按孔。不过按的孔对不对我就不知道了……
一些看起来可行但实际不可行的行动都有做动作。比如要撬个石头，手头又有个滑雪杆，玩家肯定想用滑雪杆去撬。但实际滑雪杆并不结实撬不了石头。游戏并没有只显示一下“不够结实”或者“不该用这个”之类，而是又做了个女主角尝试用滑雪杆撬但失败了的动作。
不同地形脚步声也不同。比起在平地上走，在积水中行走会有水声而且脚步会变慢。
在飞机失事时女主角到飞机后面出现的不是“返回”箭头，而是“转身”箭头，因为女主角只能在座位这边爬不到飞机后面去。要是其他游戏，就直接设个返回按钮了。
女主角车钥匙的挂件是Artifex的标志，后面还有Artifex牌的平板以及笔记本电脑。[spoiler]话说在1代里女主角用的笔记本电脑也是Artifex牌的，而且电脑里还自带《时间之谜》……然后2代里小萝莉相机里的储存卡也是Artifex牌的。然后从1代到3代游戏中所有用Artifex牌东西的角色都出了意外……非死即伤。[/spoiler]
女主角车上的收音机是可以换频道的，可以听到Artifex家其他游戏的BGM，比如《恐怖传奇1》里的婚礼BGM（我听着像）。算是彩蛋么？
[h1] 翻译[/h1]
这部的翻译很良心。语句通顺，寻物谜题翻译错误几乎没有。而且游戏中一个纸条上关于传说的语句还被翻译成了一首诗，这么文艺的翻译我以前只在《童话之谜2》里碰到过……说明这部的翻译还是很用心的。


综上所述，《乌鸦森林之谜3》是部很不错很用心的作品。值得入手。
Artifex自己开发的游戏都是很不错的。现在《深海噩梦》完结了，《恐怖传奇》完结了（应该是完结了吧），《乌鸦森林之谜》也完结了，不知道下部会出什么呢？蛮期待的。

24828714.review:
The final installment of the [i]Enigmatis[/i] series of hidden object games is here! That’s right, if you haven’t played the first two titles stop what you’re doing and fix that post haste because it will make your enjoyment of [i]Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] that much better. It’s time to stop the villain, simply known as the Preacher, once and for all before demons can be unleashed unto the world. There is action and adventure around every corner, it’s up to you as the detective to find clues and solve the case by finding a way to defeat the Preacher, but it won’t be easy.

While the previous two games took place in America, this title takes us to the mountains of Asia where the Preacher is on his way to summon his demon master Asmodai. Our main character has teamed up with Detective Hamilton from the first two titles and the pair set off on an outrageous adventure. There are plane crashes, blizzards, dead bodies, magic and more involved, plus a mysterious child named Fang who may be the key to everything. The story is rather straightforward, though does throw in a curveball or two that even I didn’t expect. The writing and pacing create a real sense of urgency as the main character races to stop the Preacher.

If you haven’t played the previous two games, this one does give somewhat of a recap so you won’t be too lost, however, the energy in this game is created from the build up of the previous titles. There aren’t many characters in this game; the focus is on the protagonist, Hamilton and the Preacher. Brittany is a helpful side character as are Fang and Po but I found things most enjoyable when it was just the two detectives and I wish the game focused more on the Preacher. That being said, everything is tied up very well in the end.  I was satisfied but also disappointed that this was truly the end. I would personally love a series of detective games following this main character and Hamilton. 

As far as gameplay is concerned, this is your traditional hidden object game. You move around and talk to people, interact with objects and collect useful ones in your inventory much like a point and click title. Some items you can examine closer and you may have to combine them with something else or another type of action. There are plenty of hidden object scenes to keep you busy that offer a varying level of challenge from easy to sometimes frustrating but never unsolvable. The puzzles are also in the same nature though most weren’t too difficult. We see return of the evidence board and deduction mode, except this time it’s on the protagonist's cell phone since we’re so modern now. Throughout the game you collect evidence and piece it together to further the story. My only issue with this is, at this point, there isn’t much to discover. We know what’s going on, we know why and we know what to do. As such, this feature is actually not used as much as in previous games with only a few deductions even available sadly.

The graphics are top notch. This game is crisp and new, filled with great animation and scenery. The character models are well done and their animation is very fluid. The locations are all gorgeous and I appreciated the attention to detail in the beginning when we revisit Maple Creek, it looked just like in the first game, location-wise. The hidden object scenes have great resolution and are easy on the eyes, no need to worry about squinting much. The music is perfect, you can even save the tracks from the game since this is a collector’s edition. Voice acting is well done and well directed. The cast is small but well selected and helps players stay immersed in the game. One issue I noticed were pronunciations of the name Fang. Other characters said it like a wolf’s fang while the main character said it differently and it made it sound more naturally Asian. I’m not sure if this was on purpose or an oversight but it’s not that big of a deal, Fang is mute so she can’t really correct anyone either way.

This trilogy was a great ride but now with [i]Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala[/i] it’s come to an end. If you’re new to hidden object games or new to this series, don’t hesitate. It’s fun, spooky and very exciting. I really enjoyed this title and despite finding some faults here and there I’d say this is a game I’d have no issues replaying. It even has a bonus chapter which tells us more about Fang and Brittany- it’s a little short but a nice addition to the game. There are Steam trading cards as well as achievements to collect if you needed even more reason to purchase this game. It’s time to stop the Preacher!

[h1]Usagi’s Rating[/h1]

[list]
[*][b]Must buy.[/b]
[*]A good game to buy.
[*]Only buy if on sale.
[*]Mediocre.
[*]Avoid at all costs.
[/list]

[url=http://lunarproduction.com/]Lunar Productions[/url]

40779698.review:
This is my favorite of this series, at least in regards to the story, because the first two games have very frustrating endings that are necessary to bring you to this ultimate showdown. So I love the finality of this one. It was very satisfying. The location is the Himalayas, which I didn't enjoy as much as the gorgeous redwood forest in the second game, but it was still lovely artwork and a pretty cool setting all told. This one is nowhere near as scary/creepy as the first two in the series, but that's because it's the endgame of the storyline and the evil of the villain is well established. At this point it's basically a race to stop him, so that gives the whole thing an exciting urgency.

All in all I'm glad I played this whole series, even if I was quite frustrated with my main character at times (but that was more so in the first two games, so I'm not dwelling on that in this review).

40722306.review:
Game Information

Enigmatis: The Shadow of Karkhala CE. is a HOPA game, that is developed and published by Artifex Mundi.

 CE - Collector's Edition.
 HOPA - Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure.

"The Shadow of Karkhala" is the final installment of the "Enigmatis" game series. Previous installments as follows: "The Ghosts of Maple Creek;" "The Mists of Ravenwood."

Since this is a collector's edition game, it comes with extra features, that are not available in its' counterpart; the standard edition.

Game Visuals

I want to mentioned that the visuals for the game is nicely done with a painted feel to them. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's menu option.

Game Audio

I want to mentioned that the audio for the game is well done even if its' simplistic and somewhat repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are four different difficulty modes to choose from: Casual; Advanced; Expert and Custom.

The notebook keeps track of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly. It also indicates that there are certain tasks that needs to be completed at certain locations within the game. The interactive map is not automatically given at the start of the game.

There is no padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place. The inventory panel is stationary.

There are some interactive items in the game. Some of these interactive items may require extra components before they can interact with. All interactive items are marked with a symbol in one of the corners.

The hidden object scenes consists of the following: Find "x" amount; Fragmented items and Traditional word lists. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interaction. Most of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them. Most of the puzzles can be replayed in the game's extra feature section as well. 

There are collectibles in the game: White feathers and flowers. They are scattered throughout the game for the player to find.

There morphing objects (beyond objects) in the game. They are scattered throughout the game for you to find as well.

There are thirty-four different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that needs to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Since this is a collector's edition game, there is a bonus chapter, it can be access only after the main story is completed.

Miscellaneous

There are extra features: Bonus Chapter; Bonus Hidden Object Scenes; Bonus Puzzles; Wallpapers; Soundtracks and Concept Art. Most of these extra features can be access only after the entire game is completed.

There are five different trading cards to collect. You only get three of those cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its' Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found this game enjoyable to certain extent. The replay value for this game is low. I would recommend this game but not at the game's full price value.
